Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, possibly containing a table of fractions.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.57)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.270)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89514) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89514)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 328 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 28 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
